intro: Oncostemum venulosum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive venation pattern. Oncostemum venulosum is often found in open habitats such as coastal dunes and disturbed areas.
